org.hobsoft.hamcrest.compose

Class ComposeMatchers

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hobsoft.hamcrest.compose.ComposeMatchers

  • public final class ComposeMatchers
extends Object
    Factory for Hamcrest Compose matchers.

    • Method Detail

      • compose

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> ConjunctionMatcher<T> compose(Matcher<? super T>... matchers)
        Returns a matcher that logically ANDs the specified matchers with any number of further matchers.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", compose(startsWith("h")).and(containsString("a")).and(endsWith("m")));
        See ConjunctionMatcher as to how this matcher differs from allOf and both.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        Parameters:
        matchers - the initial matchers to compose
        Returns:
        a matcher that can compose itself with further matchers
        See Also:
        ConjunctionMatcher

      • compose

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> ConjunctionMatcher<T> compose(String compositeDescription,
                                                             Matcher<? super T>... matchers)
        Returns a matcher that logically ANDs the specified matchers with any number of further matchers.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", compose("a word with", startsWith("h")).and(containsString("a")).and(endsWith("m")));
        See ConjunctionMatcher as to how this matcher differs from allOf and both.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        Parameters:
        compositeDescription - a description of this composite used by describeTo
        matchers - the initial matchers to compose
        Returns:
        a matcher that can compose itself with further matchers
        See Also:
        ConjunctionMatcher

      • compose

        public static <T> ConjunctionMatcher<T> compose(Iterable<Matcher<? super T>> matchers)
        Returns a matcher that logically ANDs the specified matchers with any number of further matchers.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", compose(asList(startsWith("h"), containsString("a"))).and(endsWith("m")));
        See ConjunctionMatcher as to how this matcher differs from allOf and both.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        Parameters:
        matchers - the initial matchers to compose
        Returns:
        a matcher that can compose itself with further matchers
        See Also:
        ConjunctionMatcher

      • compose

        public static <T> ConjunctionMatcher<T> compose(String compositeDescription,
                                                Iterable<Matcher<? super T>> matchers)
        Returns a matcher that logically ANDs the specified matchers with any number of further matchers.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", compose("a word with", asList(startsWith("h"), containsString("a"))).and(endsWith("m")));
        See ConjunctionMatcher as to how this matcher differs from allOf and both.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        Parameters:
        compositeDescription - a description of this composite used by describeTo
        matchers - the initial matchers to compose
        Returns:
        a matcher that can compose itself with further matchers
        See Also:
        ConjunctionMatcher

      • hasFeature

        public static <T,U> Matcher<T> hasFeature(Function<T,U> featureFunction,
                                          Matcher<? super U> featureMatcher)
        Returns a matcher that matches the specified feature of an object.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", hasFeature(s -> s.length(), equalTo(3)));
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        U - the type of the feature to be matched
        Parameters:
        featureFunction - a function to extract the feature from the object. The string representation of this function is used as the feature name for describeTo and describeMismatch.
        featureMatcher - the matcher to apply to the specified feature
        Returns:
        the feature matcher

      • hasFeature

        public static <T,U> Matcher<T> hasFeature(SerializableFunction<T,U> featureFunction,
                                          Matcher<? super U> featureMatcher)
        Returns a matcher that matches the specified feature of an object.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", hasFeature(String::length, equalTo(3)));
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        U - the type of the feature to be matched
        Parameters:
        featureFunction - a method reference to extract the feature from the object. The compiler will generate a serialized lambda that is used to obtain the feature name for describeTo and describeMismatch.
        featureMatcher - the matcher to apply to the specified feature
        Returns:
        the feature matcher

      • hasFeature

        public static <T,U> Matcher<T> hasFeature(String featureName,
                                          Function<T,U> featureFunction,
                                          Matcher<? super U> featureMatcher)
        Returns a matcher that matches the specified feature of an object.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", hasFeature("string length", String::length, equalTo(3)));
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        U - the type of the feature to be matched
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of this feature used by describeTo and describeMismatch
        featureFunction - a function to extract the feature from the object
        featureMatcher - the matcher to apply to the specified feature
        Returns:
        the feature matcher

      • hasFeature

        public static <T,U> Matcher<T> hasFeature(String featureDescription,
                                          String featureName,
                                          Function<T,U> featureFunction,
                                          Matcher<? super U> featureMatcher)
        Returns a matcher that matches the specified feature of an object.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", hasFeature("a string with length", "string length", String::length, equalTo(3)));
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        U - the type of the feature to be matched
        Parameters:
        featureDescription - a description of this feature used by describeTo
        featureName - the name of this feature used by describeMismatch
        featureFunction - a function to extract the feature from the object
        featureMatcher - the matcher to apply to the specified feature
        Returns:
        the feature matcher

      • hasFeatureValue

        public static <T,U> Matcher<T> hasFeatureValue(Function<T,U> featureFunction,
                                               U featureValue)
        Returns a matcher that matches the specified feature value of an object.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", hasFeatureValue(s -> s.length(), 3));

        This is equivalent to hasFeature(featureFunction, equalTo(featureValue)).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        U - the type of the feature to be matched
        Parameters:
        featureFunction - a function to extract the feature from the object. The string representation of this function is used as the feature name for describeTo and describeMismatch.
        featureValue - the feature value to match
        Returns:
        the feature matcher

      • hasFeatureValue

        public static <T,U> Matcher<T> hasFeatureValue(SerializableFunction<T,U> featureFunction,
                                               U featureValue)
        Returns a matcher that matches the specified feature value of an object.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", hasFeatureValue(String::length, 3));

        This is equivalent to hasFeature(featureFunction, equalTo(featureValue)).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        U - the type of the feature to be matched
        Parameters:
        featureFunction - a method reference to extract the feature from the object. The compiler will generate a serialized lambda that is used to obtain the feature name for describeTo and describeMismatch.
        featureValue - the feature value to match
        Returns:
        the feature matcher

      • hasFeatureValue

        public static <T,U> Matcher<T> hasFeatureValue(String featureName,
                                               Function<T,U> featureFunction,
                                               U featureValue)
        Returns a matcher that matches the specified feature value of an object.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", hasFeatureValue("string length", String::length, 3));

        This is equivalent to hasFeature(featureName, featureFunction, equalTo(featureValue)).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        U - the type of the feature to be matched
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of this feature used by describeTo and describeMismatch
        featureFunction - a function to extract the feature from the object
        featureValue - the feature value to match
        Returns:
        the feature matcher

      • hasFeatureValue

        public static <T,U> Matcher<T> hasFeatureValue(String featureDescription,
                                               String featureName,
                                               Function<T,U> featureFunction,
                                               U featureValue)
        Returns a matcher that matches the specified feature value of an object.

        For example: 

         assertThat("ham", hasFeatureValue("a string with length", "string length", String::length, 3));

        This is equivalent to hasFeature(featureDescription, featureName, featureFunction, equalTo(featureValue)).

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object to be matched
        U - the type of the feature to be matched
        Parameters:
        featureDescription - a description of this feature used by describeTo
        featureName - the name of this feature used by describeMismatch
        featureFunction - a function to extract the feature from the object
        featureValue - the feature value to match
        Returns:
        the feature matcher
